moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: Up until now, it has been a standard Yugoslav Attack 9.Bc4 variation. This move is certainly not a great one, as the b and a pawns hardly ever join in Black's attack. Better was 9...Qa5
moves.10. O-O-O Re8: ? A pointless move. Black should be mobilizing his Q-side.
moves.11. h4 Ne5 12. Bb3 Bd7 13. h5 Rc8 14. Bh: Black is now so woefully behind in his Q-side attack that he can only really prolong the inevitable.
moves.15. hxg6 hxg6 16. Bg5 Nc4 17. Qf2: Interesting also would have been Rxh8+. The move in the game is slightly more conservative.
moves.17... Nxb2 18. Qh4: Material is hardly what White is after. Taking the knight would have, however, been almost entirely safe.
moves.20. Bxg7 Kxg7 21. g4 Rxc3: ? Far better was the simple Nf6, but that too loses to 22.Nd5
